snippet: Court documents, federal records, news articles and interviews reveal a pattern of abuse in private extradition vans, an industry that operates with almost no oversight....
abstract: Marshall Project review of documentation related to private companies that extract and transport prisoners and fugitives reveals pattern of abuse and neglect and near complete lack of oversight; system, which financially rewards overcrowding of poorly maintained vans and minimal breaks while on road, has led to at least four prisoner deaths in United States since 2012 from causes including traffic accidents and abuse by private guards.

byline.original: By ELI HAGER and ALYSIA SANTO
byline.contributor: Dartunorro Clark and Nick Tucker contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Court documents, federal records, news articles and interviews reveal a pattern of abuse in private extradition vans, an industry that operates with almost no oversight.

headline.main: Private Prisoner Vans’ Long Road of Neglect
headline.print_headline: On Private Prisoner Vans, Long Road of Neglect
